definition: wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

sentences.english: Officials also said a car on board the ferry or suspected source of fire.
sentences.chinese: 官员还表示，渡轮上搭载的一辆汽车或为疑似火源。

sentences.english: Ferry lines across the Huangpu River will be completed within three months.
sentences.chinese: 三个月后还将开辟横渡黄浦江的渡轮线。

sentences.english: The ferry that plies between dover and boulogne.
sentences.chinese: 定期往返于多佛和布伦之间的渡轮。

sentences.english: They topped off the evening with a ferryboat ride at midnight.
sentences.chinese: 他们以午夜乘坐渡轮泛游结束了当晚的活动。

sentences.english: You can also get on one of the day ferries to get from Maui to Lanai and back.
sentences.chinese: 您也可以在一个一天渡轮从毛伊岛的凉台和背部。

sentences.english: I took the ferry to Staten Island and campaigned there.
sentences.chinese: 我乘坐渡轮到斯塔滕岛进行竞选宣传。

sentences.english: I can recognize CotaiJet among other competing brands.
sentences.chinese: 我能够在其他的渡轮品牌中认出金光飞航。

sentences.english: There are 262 outlying islands and several are served by regularferries.
sentences.chinese: 在262个边远的小岛之中有几个是有渡轮服务的。

sentences.english: In addition, a ferry and a fishing boat capsized.
sentences.chinese: 另外，一艘渡轮和一艘渔船翻沉。

sentences.english: These are ferries that ply between Hong Kong and Macao.
sentences.chinese: 这些是往返香港和澳门间的渡轮。

sentences.english: Two gangs of youths brawled on the dance floor of the ferry.
sentences.chinese: 两伙青年在渡轮的舞池里打起来了。

sentences.english: Then you will be transferred to the airport for a flight to Chongqing and spend the night in the cruise ship.
sentences.chinese: 之后到机场准备飞往重庆，晚上渡轮过夜休息。

sentences.english: Ferries were used on the Serangoon River as transport.
sentences.chinese: 渡轮过去在实龙岗河域被用作运输工具。

sentences.english: He also wanted to ride the ferries and talk to passengers and crew.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他要亲自乘坐渡轮，与乘客及工作人员交谈。
我的儿子常坐渡轮去上学。

sentences.english: Two bridges and frequent ferries already connect the two sides of the city.
sentences.chinese: 现在已经有了相当繁忙的两座桥和渡轮。

definition: to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
